solution.text:
Let the average score be x. You know that Khushi obtained _{{j*2}}_ marks and that it was twice the average score.
Therefore \( 2 \times x \) = _{{j*2}}_
\( \Rightarrow x = _{{j*2}}_ \div 2\)
\( \Rightarrow x = _{j}_\)
Let the lowest score be y. You are told that \(y = x - 20\)
Therefore y = _{{j- 20}}_
The lowest score is _{{j-20}}_

content.text: Khushi obtained _{{j*2}}_ marks in the maths examination. The teacher tells your class that Khushi’s score was the highest and that it was 2 times the average score. If the lowest score was 20 marks less than the average, what was the lowest score?
